data.current_summary: Update the remaining credits for a Subuser
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to update the remaining credits for a Subuser.**
data.description_suggestion: Updates the remaining email credits allocated to a specific Subuser. Accepts the new credit amount in the request body. Returns the updated SubuserCredits object containing the remaining, total, and used credit values. This operation modifies the Subuser's credit balance and affects their email sending capacity.
data.reasoning: The current description is minimal and lacks critical details. Added information about what inputs are expected (credit amount), what is returned (SubuserCredits object with specific fields), and important side effects (affects sending capacity). This helps AI agents understand the operation's impact and when to use it.

message: Operation 'UpdateSubuserIp' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Current description mixes context with implementation details. Improved version clarifies the input format (array of IPs), output (updated assignment), and critical operational context (all mail uses assigned IPs, reverse DNS requirement). This enables AI agents to understand the operation's purpose and prerequisites.

data.current_summary: Update IPs assigned to a subuser
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you update your subusers' assigned IP.**

Each subuser should be assigned to an IP address from which all of this subuser's mail will be sent. Often, this is the same IP as the parent account, but each subuser can have one or more of their own IP addresses as well. 

More information:

* [How to request more IPs](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/account-and-settings/dedicated-ip-addresses/)
* [Setup Reverse DNS](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/account-and-settings/how-to-set-up-reverse-dns/)
data.description_suggestion: Assigns one or more IP addresses to a Subuser for outbound email sending. Accepts an array of IP addresses in the request body. Returns the updated IP assignment for the Subuser. All mail from this Subuser will be sent through the assigned IP address(es). A Subuser can share the parent account's IP or have dedicated IP addresses. Note: Reverse DNS must be configured for proper email delivery.
data.reasoning: Current description mixes context with implementation details. Improved version clarifies the input format (array of IPs), output (updated assignment), and critical operational context (all mail uses assigned IPs, reverse DNS requirement). This enables AI agents to understand the operation's purpose and prerequisites.

message: Operation 'ListSubuserMonthlyStat' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_input_details. Original description has a typo ('retrive') and lacks details about parameters and return format. Enhanced version specifies the date range requirement, return type (array of SubuserStats), and clarifies the sorting limitation with context. This helps AI agents understand what parameters to provide and what data structure to expect.

data.current_summary: Retrieve the monthly email statistics for a single subuser
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrive the monthly email statistics for a specific subuser.**

When using the `sort_by_metric` to sort your stats by a specific metric, you can not sort by the following metrics:
`bounce_drops`, `deferred`, `invalid_emails`, `processed`, `spam_report_drops`, `spam_reports`, or `unsubscribe_drops`.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves aggregated monthly email statistics for a specific Subuser over a specified date range. Accepts parameters for date range, aggregation period, sorting, and filtering. Returns an array of SubuserStats objects containing metrics like bounces, clicks, opens, and deliveries. Note: The following metrics cannot be used for sorting: bounce_drops, deferred, invalid_emails, processed, spam_report_drops, spam_reports, and unsubscribe_drops.
data.reasoning: Original description has a typo ('retrive') and lacks details about parameters and return format. Enhanced version specifies the date range requirement, return type (array of SubuserStats), and clarifies the sorting limitation with context. This helps AI agents understand what parameters to provide and what data structure to expect.

message: Operation 'ListReputation' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_input_details. Current description explains reputation concept but lacks operational details. Improved version specifies the return format (array of reputation objects), clarifies what parameters are available, and maintains the domain context about reputation factors. This enables AI agents to understand when to use this operation and what data to expect.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to request the reputations for your subusers.**

Subuser sender reputations give a good idea how well a sender is doing with regards to how recipients and recipient servers react to the mail that is being received. When a bounce, spam report, or other negative action happens on a sent email, it will affect your sender rating.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves sender reputation metrics for all Subusers. Accepts optional parameters to filter or limit results. Returns an array of reputation objects containing reputation scores and metrics for each Subuser. Sender reputation reflects how recipients and recipient servers respond to emails from a Subuser. Negative actions like bounces, spam reports, and complaints negatively impact reputation scores.
data.reasoning: Current description explains reputation concept but lacks operational details. Improved version specifies the return format (array of reputation objects), clarifies what parameters are available, and maintains the domain context about reputation factors. This enables AI agents to understand when to use this operation and what data to expect.

message: Operation 'ListStat' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_input_details. Current description mentions the 10-subuser limit but lacks details about date range, aggregation options, and return format. Enhanced version specifies the parameter types, return structure (SubuserStats array), and aggregation capabilities. This helps AI agents understand the operation's full capabilities and constraints.

data.current_summary: Retrieve email statistics for your subusers.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve the email statistics for the given subusers.**

You may retrieve statistics for up to 10 different subusers by including an additional _subusers_ parameter for each additional subuser.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics for specified Subusers over a given date range. Accepts parameters for Subuser names (up to 10), date range, aggregation period, sorting, and filtering. Returns an array of SubuserStats objects containing metrics such as bounces, clicks, opens, deliveries, and other email performance indicators. Statistics can be aggregated by day, week, or month.
data.reasoning: Current description mentions the 10-subuser limit but lacks details about date range, aggregation options, and return format. Enhanced version specifies the parameter types, return structure (SubuserStats array), and aggregation capabilities. This helps AI agents understand the operation's full capabilities and constraints.

Improved version specifies that it returns an array of SubuserStats objects, clarifies the date range requirement, and maintains the sorting limitation context. This enables AI agents to understand the operation's scope and constraints.

data.current_summary: Retrieve monthly stats for all subusers
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve the monthly email statistics for all subusers over the given date range.**

When using the `sort_by_metric` to sort your stats by a specific metric, you can not sort by the following metrics:
`bounce_drops`, `deferred`, `invalid_emails`, `processed`, `spam_report_drops`, `spam_reports`, or `unsubscribe_drops`.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves aggregated monthly email statistics for all Subusers over a specified date range. Accepts parameters for date range, sorting, and filtering options. Returns an array of SubuserStats objects containing monthly aggregated metrics for each Subuser. Note: The following metrics cannot be used for sorting: bounce_drops, deferred, invalid_emails, processed, spam_report_drops, spam_reports, and unsubscribe_drops.
data.reasoning: Current description lacks clarity on input parameters and return format. Improved version specifies that it returns an array of SubuserStats objects, clarifies the date range requirement, and maintains the sorting limitation context. This enables AI agents to understand the operation's scope and constraints.

message: Operation 'ListStatSum' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_input_details. Current description is vague about parameters and return format. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation versus the per-Subuser statistics operations.

data.current_summary: Retrieve the totals for each email statistic metric for all subusers.
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve the total sums of each email statistic metric for all subusers over the given date range.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves aggregated totals of all email statistics across all Subusers over a specified date range. Accepts parameters for date range, aggregation period, sorting, and filtering. Returns a CategoryStats object containing summed metrics such as total bounces, clicks, opens, deliveries, and other performance indicators. Useful for obtaining account-wide email performance summaries.
data.reasoning: Current description is vague about parameters and return format. Enhanced version specifies the return type (CategoryStats object), clarifies available parameters, and explains the use case (account-wide summaries). This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation versus the per-Subuser statistics operations.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to create a new subuser.**
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Subuser account with the provided credentials and configuration. Requires authentication. Accepts username, email, password, and optional credit allocation in the request body. Returns the newly created Subuser object with assigned ID and status. The new Subuser will be active and ready to send emails upon creation.
data.reasoning: Current description is too minimal. message: Operation 'UpdateSubuser' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original description lacks specificity about inputs and outputs. Enhanced version clarifies that the operation toggles the 'active' status, specifies the path parameter requirement, explains the request body format, describes the return value, and notes the side effect (disabled Subusers cannot send). This helps AI agents understand the exact mechanism and implications.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to enable or disable a subuser.**
data.description_suggestion: Enables or disables a Subuser account by updating its active status. Requires the Subuser name as a path parameter and a request body specifying the desired active state (true/false). Returns the updated Subuser object reflecting the new status. Disabled Subusers cannot send emails but retain their configuration and data.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks specificity about inputs and outputs. Enhanced version clarifies that the operation toggles the 'active' status, specifies the path parameter requirement, explains the request body format, describes the return value, and notes the side effect (disabled Subusers cannot send). This helps AI agents understand the exact mechanism and implications.

message: Operation 'DeleteSubuser' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Current description mentions permanence but lacks input/output details. Enhanced version specifies the path parameter requirement, authentication need, explicit return status code (204), and adds a practical warning about checking for active operations. This provides AI agents with complete information about what to provide and expect.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a subuser.**

This is a permanent action. Once deleted, a subuser cannot be retrieved.
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a Subuser account specified by the subuser_name path parameter. Requires authentication. This action is irreversible - all Subuser data, configuration, and sending history will be removed. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion. Ensure the Subuser has no active sending operations before deletion.
